ashtanga_advanced_practices.title: Pratyahara - Mastery of Sensory Withdrawal

traditional_foundation.vyasa_commentary: Vyasa explains that Pratyahara is like the mind's own form being imitated by the senses, where they withdraw from their objects and follow the mind's direction.

shanmukhi_mudra.method: Seal six openings of the head to turn attention inward
shanmukhi_mudra.progression: Start with 5 minutes, gradually extend to 30 minutes
shanmukhi_mudra.inner_experiences: Hearing inner sounds (nada), seeing inner lights (jyoti)

trataka_advanced.external_phase: Steady gazing at candle flame without blinking
trataka_advanced.merger_phase: Becoming one with the inner flame

prana_dharana.technique: Following breath movement internally without external focus
prana_dharana.advanced_stage: Merging individual prana with cosmic prana
prana_dharana.result: Natural spontaneous pratyahara during daily activities

signs_of_mastery: Ability to meditate in noisy environments

foundation.meaning: Dharana is binding consciousness to a particular place or object.

gross_object_dharana.external_objects: Yantra, murti, natural objects like flowers or crystals
gross_object_dharana.duration: Hold attention without wavering for 12 seconds minimum
gross_object_dharana.quality: Vivid, clear perception without mental commentary
gross_object_dharana.transition: From external object to mental image of same object

subtle_object_dharana.chakra_points: Concentration on energy centers and their qualities
subtle_object_dharana.abstract_concepts: Focusing on love, peace, truth as living realities
subtle_object_dharana.mantric_dharana: Single-pointed focus on mantra sound and meaning
subtle_object_dharana.breathing_patterns: Following specific pranayama rhythms as concentration object

formless_dharana.space_consciousness: Awareness of infinite space within and without
formless_dharana.void_meditation: Focusing on emptiness or absence of objects
formless_dharana.self_inquiry: Who is the one who concentrates? - investigation of the concentrator

advanced_obstacles.laya: Mental dissolution or dullness - overcome through pranayama
advanced_obstacles.vikshepa: Mental distraction - overcome through systematic practice
advanced_obstacles.kashaya: Residual desires surfacing - overcome through detachment
advanced_obstacles.rasasvada: Attachment to blissful experiences - overcome through discrimination

prema_bhakti_stages.title: Navadha Bhakti - Nine Forms of Supreme Devotion

scriptural_foundation.original_sanskrit: श्रवणं कीर्तनं विष्णोः स्मरणं पादसेवनम् । अर्चनं वन्दनं दास्यं सख्यमात्मनिवेदनम् ॥
scriptural_foundation.transliteration: śravaṇaṃ kīrtanaṃ viṣṇoḥ smaraṇaṃ pādasevanam | arcanaṃ vandanaṃ dāsyaṃ sakhyam ātmanivedanam ||
scriptural_foundation.meaning: Hearing, chanting, remembering, serving feet, worship, prostration, servitude, friendship, and complete surrender of self.

shravana_advanced.technique: Deep listening to scriptures with complete absorption
shravana_advanced.inner_process: Allowing divine stories to transform consciousness
shravana_advanced.psychological_effect: Dissolution of ego through divine identification

kirtana_mastery.vocal_technique: Singing from heart center, not just throat
kirtana_mastery.emotional_engagement: Complete involvement of all emotions in divine love
kirtana_mastery.inner_kirtana: Continuous inner chanting without external expression

smarana_depths.roopamrti: Constant visualization of beloved deity form

bhava_development.sakhya_bhava: Friendship with Divine as intimate companion
bhava_development.vatsalya_bhava: Parental love toward Divine as child
bhava_development.madhurya_bhava: Romantic love - highest intimacy with Divine

ramana_methodology.systematic_negation: I am not the body, not the mind, not the intellect...
ramana_methodology.pure_inquiry: Who is aware of these states and changes?
ramana_methodology.final_recognition: I am pure awareness, the unchanging witness

source_inquiry.method: Trace every thought back to its source
source_inquiry.practice: Ask 'To whom does this thought arise?'

witness_recognition.technique: Identify awareness that observes all states
witness_recognition.practice: Remain as the observer, not the observed
witness_recognition.insight: Witness never changes, only observed phenomena change
witness_recognition.realization: I am the eternal, unchanging witness-consciousness

sahaja_samadhi.description: Natural state of Self-realization in daily life
sahaja_samadhi.characteristic: Ego-thought never arises or immediately subsides

obstacles_and_solutions.intellectual_understanding: Move from concept to direct experience
obstacles_and_solutions.subtle_ego: Watch for 'I am realized' thought - this is still ego
obstacles_and_solutions.effort_vs_effortlessness: Initial effort leads to effortless being
obstacles_and_solutions.fear_of_annihilation: Understand that only false self dies, true Self is eternal

nishkama_karma_mastery.title: Yajna Buddhi - Sacrificial Consciousness in Action

gita_foundation.original_sanskrit: यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः । तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर ॥
gita_foundation.transliteration: yajñārthāt karmaṇo 'nyatra loko 'yaṃ karmabandhanaḥ | tadarthaṃ karma kaunteya muktasaṅgaḥ samācara ||
gita_foundation.meaning: Except for action done as sacrifice, this world is bound by action. Therefore, O Arjuna, perform action for that purpose, free from attachment.

divine_instrument.consciousness: I am merely an instrument in divine hands
divine_instrument.practice: Offer every action as sacred service
divine_instrument.attitude: Surrender both action and results to Divine
divine_instrument.result: Freedom from doership and anxiety about outcomes

world_as_temple.methodology: Transform secular work into spiritual practice

skill_in_action.balanced_mind: Maintaining equanimity in success and failure
skill_in_action.intelligent_action: Acting with wisdom, not just mechanical effort

pratyabhijna_practices.title: Spanda Yoga - Dynamic Recognition of Divine Consciousness

philosophical_base.original_sanskrit: चिदानन्दघन आत्मा न तु शून्यः शिवोऽद्वयः ।
philosophical_base.transliteration: cidānandaghana ātmā na tu śūnyaḥ śivo 'dvayaḥ
philosophical_base.meaning: The Self is dense with consciousness and bliss, not void; Shiva is non-dual.

iccha_shakti_recognition.method: Recognize divine will (iccha) in every desire that arises
iccha_shakti_recognition.practice: Before acting on any desire, pause and recognize it as divine impulse
iccha_shakti_recognition.transformation: Desires become divine play rather than binding attachments
iccha_shakti_recognition.result: Freedom within action, spontaneous right action

jnana_shakti_awakening.technique: See every thought as divine knowledge manifesting
jnana_shakti_awakening.approach: Welcome all thoughts as expressions of cosmic intelligence
jnana_shakti_awakening.insight: No thought is 'mine' - all are divine consciousness flowing

kriya_shakti_embodiment.understanding: Every action is divine creative power (kriya) expressing
kriya_shakti_embodiment.practice: Perform all activities as divine creative expression
kriya_shakti_embodiment.attitude: Body-mind is temple where Shiva-Shakti dance

preparation.physical: Purification through yoga asanas and pranayama
preparation.mental: Surrender of personal will and complete devotion
preparation.emotional: Opening heart through love and gratitude
preparation.spiritual: Recognition of guru as Shiva-Shakti embodied

integration_process.initial_awakening: Sudden influx of divine energy and awareness
integration_process.embodiment: Natural, effortless expression of divine qualities
